items.title: in2pbProject field schema
items.description: in2pbProject field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.54

literals.label: PhD Project 1: Layer-specific dynamics of parieto-motor networks during visually-guided arm reaching behavior.
PhD Project 2: Dynamic neuronal interactions along visuomotor pathways
PhD Project 3: Cortical interactions for processing motion information in marmosets
PhD Project 4: Multi-scale neural networks dynamic and cognitive brain-computer interfaces
PhD Project 5: Large-scale brain networks through primate evolution
PhD Project 6: Modulating neuronal network information processing by selective stimulation of monkey visual cortex
PhD Project 7: Probing the link between perceptual visibility and brain oscillations
PhD Project 8: Reaching and grasping in dorsal and ventral premotor cortex: distinct networks or intertwined information processing for object location and shape
PhD Project 9: Local circuits and long-range neuronal interactions that mediate cognitive functions
PhD Project 10: Role of the frontal cortex in high level cognitive and social functions for mentalizing
PhD Project 11: Cortical and sub-cortical interactions during reach, and their reconfiguration after cortical lesion
PhD Project 12: Feedforward and feedback circuit mechanisms in the visual system
PhD Project 13: Design and development of a chronic, long-term stable, drivable, deep brain probe system for NHP
PhD Project 14: Comprehensive management of complex data from NHP brain network studies
PhD Project 15: Development of a novel and comprehensive test panel to evaluate cognitive functions for regulatory drug development

propertyDescriptions.referenceCitation: Please provide the full reference, including title, authors, journal etc., like in the reference section of a paper. If an unpublished manuscript is referenced, enter as much citation information as available, and update when the paper is published.
propertyDescriptions.refernceIdentifier: Digital identifier (e.g., DOI, arXiv, PMID, URL) of the refernce if possible.  Add a prefix to the ID, separated by a colon, to indicate the type of identifier. If assignment of an identifier is pending, enter "doi:tba" as placeholder.
propertyDescriptions.referenceType: The relationship of this dataset to the referenced resource.

in2pb-header.title: in2pb-header field schema
in2pb-header.description: in2pb-header field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

_ui._content:
In2PrimateBrains Metadata Template

The template here aims to allow the researchers to contribute structured metadata describing their experiments intuitively using a form-based and spreadsheet like interface. This in turns enhances the findability, accessibility, interoperability, and reusability (FAIR) of your contributed datasets.

This metadata template was developed based on existing data standards and minimum reporting guidelines by the research team at the Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München (LMU) and the German Neuroinformatics Node. The template was built as a part of the In2PrimateBrains Project, funded by MSCA-ITN-H2020 Grant Number 956669.

The template was built with the Center for Expanded Data Annotation and Retrieval (CEDAR) Workbench.

If you need any clarification about this form or if you're interested in contributing, please reach out to Reema Gupta (reema.gupta@lmu.de).

Tips for using this form:

  1. To see the description of the field, hover the cursor on
  2. There may be too many items in the drop-down menu for fields assigned with ontological support. Please enter the first few letters of your desired value and wait for a few seconds. The form will attempt to autocomplete your entry with standardized vocabulary.
  3. In the top-right corner, you can use the “Copy” button  to duplicate the field or element, or the “Toggle View” button  to switch to a tabular spreadsheet-like view for metadata entry. This applies to fields or elements that allow multiple entries.
  4. If the information is not available or is not applicable, leave the field blank.
  5. Use the free text field at the end of the template to provide any other additional information that you may want to convey.

dataset-general-element.title: Dataset-general-element element schema
dataset-general-element.description: Dataset-general-element element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.acknowledgements: Text acknowledging contributions of individuals or institutions beyond those listed in authors or funding.
propertyDescriptions.datasetType: The type(s) of data present in the dataset.
propertyDescriptions.datasetLicense: The open-source license associated with the use of the dataset being described. Use this URL to choose a creative commons license: https://chooser-beta.creativecommons.org/
propertyDescriptions.howToAcknowledge: Text containing instructions on how researchers using this dataset should acknowledge the original authors. This field can also be used to define a publication that should be cited in publications that use the dataset.
propertyDescriptions.funding: List of sources of funding. Please use grant numbers wherever possible.
propertyDescriptions.ethicsApproval: Specifies documented ethics approval for animal experiments, ensuring compliance with ethical and welfare standards. Required to demonstrate adherence to ethical guidelines and humane treatment of animals.
propertyDescriptions.datasetDOI: Indicate the dataset's unique Digital Object Identifier (DOI), ensuring it refers to the dataset itself rather than any associated publications. Format DOIs as valid URIs, starting with 'doi:' followed by the identifier.
propertyDescriptions.title: Name of the dataset.
propertyDescriptions.description: A brief abstract describing the dataset.
propertyDescriptions.otherDatasetLicense: Use this field to specify the license name and URL if "other" is used in the field above.

dataset-description-header.title: dataset-description-header field schema
dataset-description-header.description: dataset-description-header field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

_ui._content:
Dataset Description Template

The purpose of this template is to describe the dataset.

This template is further divided into 5 different sections:

  1. General Metadata:  This section is intended to provide general information about the dataset such as the name(title), funding, licence, etc. Please read more information on licensing your data here. If you wish to use a creative commons license, you can use this license chooser.
  2. Author Metadata: This section is to list the authors of the dataset. For the author identifier, use a prefix such as ORCID, ISNI or ROR for the identifier type, followed by the identifier string. For example, “ORCID:0000-0001-2345-6789”
  3. Reference Metadata: This section is to be used to provide information on the references associated with the dataset.
  4. In2PrimateBrains Metadata: Use this section to specify the In2PB project with which this dataset is associated with.
  5. Experiment Overview: This section is to be used to provide a very brief overview of the experiment that generated the data.
